image.altText: Child's hand on play equipment

props.synopsis: Labor will introduce the legislation this morning but will not say what the benchmark for failure is and how it will be defined.

title.children: Laws that strip childcare funding from centres breaching standards to be introduced

image.altText: A vibrant 2D illustration featuring an abstract silhouette of a person and many overlapping envelope icons on red background

props.synopsis: How a malicious email barrage led to a hacker community, claims of extortion, and an insight into the dark side of online gambling.

title.children: 'Serpent' exposed online scammers, before he was accused himself

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks while seated.

props.synopsis: Democrats are accusing Republicans of an "epic cover-up" as Donald Trump's party effectively closes Congress early to prevent a vote on the Jeffrey Epstein issue.

title.children: US Congress headed for early shutdown as Republicans avoid Epstein vote

image.altText: close up of man with long black hair and a pair or purple-shaded glasses on

props.synopsis: Described as one of the founders of heavy metal music, John Michael Osbourne was known for his incredible voice and charisma.

title.children: Ozzy Osbourne, Black Sabbath frontman and reality TV star, dies aged 76

image.altText: Anthony Albanese walks through white smoke, Susan Ley is about to walk through the smoke too

props.synopsis: During this term of parliament, the prime minister must show bravery and deliver meaningful change in Indigenous affairs, not culture war flashpoints.

title.children: Smoking ceremony may signal new action on Indigenous affairs

image.altText: French girl with brown hair holds Chinese and French flags seated next to Chinese students on either side in large hall

props.synopsis: Beijing is launching a charm offensive aimed at the younger generation of Australians — because shaping minds today means shaping alliances tomorrow.

title.children: China wants to win hearts, starting with Australia's youth

image.altText: Elisa and Brent

props.synopsis: A Brisbane couple was devastated when prenatal tests showed the baby they had longed for had a serious genetic abnormality. Then their hospital told them it wouldn't perform a termination, leaving them feeling "abandoned".

title.children: Couple expected 'world class' care at the Mater, but went 'through hell'

image.altText: First Nations and Pasifika players celebrate against the Lions.

props.synopsis: Kurtley Beale hopes the First Nations and Pasifika XV will inspire the next generation of rugby players following its gripping performance against the British and Irish Lions.

title.children: Beale pushes for First Nations and Pasifika XV to become permanent fixture

image.altText: Close up shot of DOnald Trump in a blue suit and red tie

props.synopsis: Legal experts say US defamation laws make cases brought forward by public figures "extremely" difficult for them to win.

title.children: Murdoch defamation case could be 'impossible' for Trump to win, experts say

image.altText: A man with short buzzed red hair wears dark grey-blue surgical scrubs while sitting in front of a laptop at a desk in an office.

props.synopsis: Warringal Private Hospital terminates neurosurgeon Greg Malham's temporary credentialing after a Four Corners investigation exposes allegations of poor behaviour.

title.children: Private hospital terminates neurosurgeon after Four Corners investigation

image.altText: An empty rail line in Sydney

props.synopsis: For decades, conversations have focused on what needs to be done to 'detangle' Sydney's train network so that a major incident on one line doesn't have such a domino effect on the others.

title.children: Could a new 'long-term' plan for Sydney's trains stop the chaos for good?

image.altText: Woman with brown hair in a burgundy top leaning against a wooden pole.

props.synopsis: As new Labor MP Ali France enters parliament, the surgeon who saved her life by taking her leg in 2011 is telling his story for the first time.

title.children: 'Life before limb': As Ali France enters parliament the surgeon who saved her speaks out

image.altText: An elderly couple standing in front of an old house which is undergoing minor construction.

props.synopsis: Moved by stories of homelessness, a Tasmanian couple has taken it upon themselves to offer a solution to the state's housing crisis.

title.children: Philanthropic couple buy Hobart property as social housing for older women

image.altText: A young boy holding an empty pot waiting for food.

props.synopsis: Local health officials in the Hamas-controlled Palestinian enclave say starvation is now killing Palestinians at a faster rate than at any point in the 21-month war.

title.children: Baby among 15 to die of starvation in Gaza in one day, say medics

image.altText: A composite image of a man and a woman.

props.synopsis: Greens co-founder Drew Hutton has responded to his expulsion from the party, saying the Greens have lost focus on environmental issues and become "authoritarian and aggressive".

title.children: Greens co-founder slams party as 'authoritarian, aggressive, unlikeable'

image.altText: For sale sign on Queenslander-style house that needs renovating in a street in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Buying or selling? Here's how new disclosure laws could cost you more or crash your contract. Here's what you need to know.

title.children: New real estate laws set to make it more expensive to sell your property

image.altText: A group of protestors stand outside at night holding a big sign saying JUSTICA POR DOM E BRUNO with pictures of both men

props.synopsis: Three years ago, a British journalist and a Brazilian ranger disappeared in the Amazon. A new podcast tells their story, and shows how the fight for the forest impacts us all.

title.children: How Dom and Bruno were caught in the bloody fight for the Amazon

image.altText: A female doctor carrying a stethoscope.

props.synopsis: Not a single medical school in Australia currently offers the option to go part-time, but mother and student Lisa Ross is calling for change.

title.children: Calls for part-time study option to ease burden on medical students

image.altText: A crowd of workmen in yellow hardhats and orange high-vis vests swing hammers at a beachside bar.

props.synopsis: Officials have begun destroying beachside villas and restaurants in a tourist haven in southern Bali after 48 businesses were assessed to be "illegally built".

title.children: 'None of them have permits': Popular Bali tourist spots destroyed with hammers

image.altText: Penny Wong

props.synopsis: Public outrage as the Palestinian death toll has climbed has been followed only slowly by official statements from governments reluctant to criticise Israel — until now.

title.children: Australia condemns Israel as calls for sanctions grow louder

image.altText: Prince George

props.synopsis: The Prince and Princess of Wales have released a new photo of Prince George to mark his 12th birthday.

title.children: New photo of Prince George released as royals mark his 12th birthday

image.altText: Independent NSW upper house MP Mark Latham

props.synopsis: A series of amendments to the workers compensation bill carry the name of Mark Latham, with NSW Liberals saying they will work with the MP on the matter.

title.children: 'You've got to hold your nose': Opposition leader defends working with Latham

image.altText: Police on scene after boy dies in jet ski crash

props.synopsis: A 15-year-old boy is dead and another is fighting for life after sustaining a severed arm in a jet ski crash in Sydney's south.

title.children: One teen dead, another fighting for life after Sydney jet ski crash

image.altText: A photo of Etan Patz hanging off an angel ornament

props.synopsis: The disappearance of six-year-old Etan Patz in 1979 horrified New Yorkers. On Monday, Pedro Hernandez's conviction was overturned.

title.children: Conviction overturned for man accused of killing 'milk carton' kid Etan Patz in 1979

image.altText: Martin Luther King Jr.

props.synopsis: The digital document bundle includes more than 240,000 pages of records that had been under a court-imposed seal since 1977.

title.children: Trump releases thousands of records on Martin Luther King Jr

image.altText: A piece of a broken plane sits surrounded by trees and emergency workers

props.synopsis: Air India has completed precautionary inspections on the fuel control switches on all its Boeing BA.N 787 and 737 aircraft.

title.children: Air India says 'no issues found' with fuel control switches on Boeing fleet

image.altText: Two men wade through floodwaters with their belongings lifted over their shoulders as water laps at their waists

props.synopsis: Tropical Storm Wipha has forced tens of thousands of people to relocate in Manila, where heavy rain in low-lying areas has seen a river burst its banks.

title.children: Six people killed in major flooding in the Philippines with more rain forecast

image.altText: An external shot of a police station.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's Aboriginal legal aid service says children as young as 11 are being held overnight at the Palmerston police watch house "with the lights on 24 hours a day", describing the conditions as "breach of human rights".

title.children: 11yo girl held overnight at NT police watch house

image.altText: man and woman stand in kitchen looking uphappy

props.synopsis: There are many reasons someone can be moody, bad-tempered, or sullen, but regardless of why, experts say regular occurrences can lead to disconnect and resentment in relationships.

title.children: The toll of living with someone who is frequently moody

image.altText: Hunter Biden seated outside by a tree in a garden, wearing a button-down shirt and wrist watch, speaking to interviewer.

props.synopsis: Hunter Biden spoke candidly about his previous addictions to crack cocaine and alcohol and criticised Democrats who turned against his father, former US president Joe Biden.

title.children: Hunter Biden takes aim at George Clooney for undermining his dad

image.altText: Ed Sheeran sits on a pink plastic chair in a pink jumper.

props.synopsis: Ed Sheeran will bring his Loop tour to Australia and New Zealand in 2026.

title.children: Ed Sheeran announces return to Australia following record-breaking tour

image.altText: Jeremy Rockliff speaks while standing behind a lectern

props.synopsis: As Jeremy Rockliff continues his pursuit of engineering a minority Liberal government after the weekend's Tasmanian election, the ABC calls a 10th seat for Labor.

title.children: 'Stability' offered to independents, as Labor picks up another seat

image.altText: A group of people in front of a brick building holding protest signs. One reads protect academic freedom.

props.synopsis: Harvard University's fight to keep billions of dollars in US government funding has made its way to court. Here is what you need to know.

title.children: Harvard has taken Trump's admin to court over a funding freeze. Here's why

image.altText: A generic image of a phone with a lock image and password on the screen

props.synopsis: We asked some experts how password managers work and how they can increase security for those wanting to keep their data secure.

title.children: What is a password manager and are they safe?
